io.spine.web.firebase

Class NodeValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.web.firebase.NodeValue

  • public final class NodeValue
extends java.lang.Object
    The Firebase database node value.

    • Method Detail

      • empty

        public static NodeValue empty()
        Creates an empty NodeValue.

        This is not equivalent to the null value. An empty value is supposed to be filled with entries at some point after the creation.

      • withChildren

        public static NodeValue withChildren(java.lang.Iterable<StoredJson> jsons)
        Creates a new node value with all the given JSONs as its children.

        The child nodes are added under generated keys.

        Parameters:
        jsons - child nodes
        Returns:
        new node value

      • toByteArray

        public com.google.api.client.http.ByteArrayContent toByteArray()
        Converts the value to the byte array suitable for usage in the HTTP request.

      • addChild

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
public java.lang.String addChild(StoredJson data)
        Adds a child to the value.

        The key for the child is generated via standard Firebase generation mechanism.

        Returns:
        the generated key under which the data was stored

      • addChild

        public void addChild(java.lang.String key,
                     StoredJson data)
        Adds a child to the value under a specified key.

      • addNullChild

        public void addNullChild(java.lang.String key)
        Adds a `null` child to the value under a specified key.
